text: do you know which holidays Americans
celebrate in the fall I enjoy Halloween
it's in October every year on October
31st children wear costumes and in the
evening they go trick-or-treating around
the neighborhood it's a lot of fun

look closely try to understand the use
of in and on do you know which holidays
Americans celebrate in the fall I enjoy
Halloween it's in October every year on
October 31st children wear costumes and
in the evening they go trick-or-treating
around the neighborhood it's a lot of
fun when do we use in when do we use on
we use in with months for example in
January let's go through all 12 months
we can say in January in February in
March in April in May in June in July in
August in September in October in
November in December we can use in with
seasons for example in the spring so we
can say in the spring in the springtime
in the summer in the summer time in the
winter and in the wintertime autumn and
fall are a little different with autumn
we don't usually use the article but if
we say fall we do use the article with
all the other seasons you can choose to
use the article or not
we use in with years for example in 2008
in 2009 but we don't say in last year in
next year or in every year the correct
phrases are last year next year every
year so we don't use the preposition in
before last
next and every we use in with times of
the day for example in the morning so we
say in the morning in the afternoon in
the evening but we don't say in night
the correct way to say this is at night
we use on with dates for example on
January 1st on July 4th 1776
we use on with days of the week for
example on Sunday let's go through the
days of the week we can say on Sunday on
Monday on Tuesday on Wednesday on
Thursday on Friday on Saturday
we use on when we have a time of the day
and a day of the week for example on
Sunday morning
and we use on with holidays for example
on Mother's Day now Christmas is special
in more than one way with the
preposition on we say on Christmas Eve
and on Christmas Day but we usually say
at Christmas look at these other uses of
on we say on the weekend on a weekday on
a workday

some American holidays exercise one

February

B Valentine's Day is on February 14th

see the family has dinner in the evening
exercise three watch and listen
are there any holidays in the summer yes
the fourth of July what do you like to
do on the fourth of July I like to see
the fireworks when was the first
celebration of Independence Day in 1776
do you remember let's complete these
sentences together a Americans celebrate
Independence Day in the summer or we can
say in the summertime
be Independence Day is on July 4th see
the first Independence Day was in 1776
exercise for ask a friend these
questions or write your answers to these
questions one what is your favorite
holiday - when do you celebrate this
holiday three what do you do on this
